name: MVP Launch Track
description: Ship a minimum viable product quickly and safely without over-engineering
objectives: Ship working code to production quickly
Avoid premature optimization and complex architectures

milestones.name: Validate the Problem
milestones.description: Ensure you're building something people need

steps.why: Validate you're solving a real problem before writing code

checkpoint.question: Can you describe the problem without mentioning your solution?

steps.why: Sketch how users will accomplish their goals

milestones.name: Plan Simply
milestones.description: Design for MVP scale, not future complexity

steps.why: Identify the 3 most critical security risks to address now

checkpoint.question: Have you identified at least 3 potential threats and mitigation strategies?

steps.why: Choose the simplest architecture that could work for your MVP
Learn when NOT to use complex architectures - avoid over-engineering

checkpoint.question: Do you understand the quantitative thresholds for architecture decisions?
reflection: Does your current scale justify architectural complexity?
What's the simplest solution that meets your actual needs?
Can you defer this decision until you have more data?

steps.why: Understand where data flows to spot security and compliance issues

milestones.name: Build Securely
milestones.description: Write code that works and is safe enough

steps.why: Prevent SQL injection, XSS, and other critical vulnerabilities
Never commit credentials to version control
Write code that's readable enough to debug later
Test critical business logic and security boundaries
Run basic security scans before shipping

milestones.name: Ship Safely
milestones.description: Deploy with ability to rollback and monitor

steps.why: Ship with a rollback plan - because things will break

milestones.name: Know When It Breaks
milestones.description: Basic monitoring to catch critical failures

steps.why: Get alerted when things break so you can fix them
Have a way to recover from data loss

completion_criteria: Identified and mitigated top 3 security threats
Chose simple, appropriate architecture for current scale
Implemented basic security practices (no secrets in code, input validation)
Have basic monitoring to know if system is up/down
next_steps: After shipping MVP and validating product-market fit, consider production-ready track
If handling sensitive data or need compliance, review security-hardening track
Once you have real users and usage data, revisit architecture decisions with actual metrics
